title.narrative: JUVENILE JUSTICE

description.narrative: 3.4. Children in conflict with the law have access to a specialized juvenile justice systems aligned with international standards., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Child Protection â€“ General, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from a violence-free environment, a child protection system that guarantees a quality and appropriate response, and a juvenile justice system in compliance with international standards.

related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/883 PR 3: PROTECTION & JUSTICE FOR CHILD & A

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.4. Children in conflict with the law have access to a specialized juvenile justice systems aligned with internationalstandards.

description.narrative: Through policy dialogue, evidence and technical support, UNICEF advocated for a juvenile justice reform according to human rights standards. Even though this reform had not taken place, UNICEF was a key actor to prevent the approval of a regressive bill.Moreover, UNICEF worked to strengthen provincial juvenile justice systems by promoting the implementation of alternative measures to detention and by supporting organisms that monitored juvenile detention centers.UNICEF also advocated on the consolidation of information systems and worked on the prevention of police abuse cases. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/08/2021

title.narrative: Number of initiatives (advocacy instances, studies, assessments, work documents, agreements and protocols) that support the existence of a national juvenile justice law and specialized systems at provincial level in accordance with the CRC.(40816)
Percentage of adolescents in conflict with the law who access alternative measures to deprivation of liberty in 3-4 provinces(40818)
Number of professionals and technical operators of the system of justice that receive specific training at provincial level(47172), Text
Number pilot projects, programs and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms(54700)
Existence of a validated model for the monitoring of detention centers by independent organizations implemented at provincial level in accordance with the CRC.(40909)
Existence of a draft bill proposal for a national law on juvenile justice in accordance with the CRC with the consensus of stakeholders.(40817)
